com.whirvis.jraknet.chat.server

Class ChatServer

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.whirvis.jraknet.server.RakNetServer
      • com.whirvis.jraknet.chat.server.ChatServer
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    RakNetServerListener

    public final class ChatServer
extends RakNetServer
    A simple chat server built using JRakNet.
    Since:
    JRakNet v2.0.0
    Author:
    Trent "Whirvis" Summerlin

    • Constructor Detail

      • ChatServer

        private ChatServer(int port,
                   int maxConnections,
                   java.lang.String name,
                   java.lang.String motd)
            throws java.lang.NullPointerException
        Creates a chat server.
        Parameters:
        port - the port the server will bind to during startup.
        maxConnections - the maximum number of connections, A value of will allow for an infinite number of connections.
        name - the server name.
        motd - the server message of the day.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if the server name or server motd are null.

        public void addChannel(int channel,
                       java.lang.String name)
                throws InvalidChannelException,
                       java.lang.NullPointerException
        Adds a channel to the server.
        Parameters:
        channel - the channel ID.
        name - the name of the channel.
        Throws:
        InvalidChannelException - if the channel. ID is greater than or equal to .
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if the name is null.

        Throws:
        InvalidChannelException - if the channel. ID is greater than or equal to .

                              int channel,
                              boolean print)
                       throws java.lang.NullPointerException,
                              InvalidChannelException
        Broadcasts the specified message on the specified channel.
        Parameters:
        message - the message to send.
        channel - the channel to send the message to.
        print - true the message should be printed to the console, false otherwise.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if the message is null.
        InvalidChannelException - if the channel. ID is greater than or equal to

      • kickUser

        public void kickUser(ChatUser user,
                     java.lang.String reason)
              throws java.lang.NullPointerException
        Kicks the specified user from the server.
        Parameters:
        user - the user to kick.
        reason - the reason the user was kicked, a null value will have "Kicked" be used instead.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if the user is null.

      • handleMessage

        public void handleMessage(RakNetServer server,
                          RakNetClientPeer peer,
                          RakNetPacket packet,
                          int channel)
        Description copied from interface: RakNetServerListener
        Called when a packet has been received from a client and is ready to be handled.
        Parameters:
        server - the server.
        peer - the client that sent the packet.
        packet - the packet received from the client.
        channel - the channel the packet was sent on.

      • onDisconnect

        public void onDisconnect(RakNetServer server,
                         java.net.InetSocketAddress address,
                         RakNetClientPeer peer,
                         java.lang.String reason)
        Description copied from interface: RakNetServerListener
        Called when a client has disconnected from the server.
        Parameters:
        server - the server.
        address - the address of the client that disconnected.
        peer - the client that disconnected, this will be null if the client has not yet logged in.
        reason - the reason the client disconnected.

      • main

        public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
                 throws RakNetException
        The entry point for the chat server.
        Parameters:
        args - the program arguments. These values are ignored.
        Throws:
        RakNetException - if a RakNet error occurs.
